definitions.definition: To have a frown on one's face.
examples: She frowned when I told her the news.

definitions.definition: To manifest displeasure or disapprobation ; to look with disfavour or threateningly .
examples: Noisy gossip in the library is frowned upon.

definitions.definition: To repress or repel by expressing displeasure or disapproval ; to rebuke with a look.
examples: Let us frown the impudent fellow into silence.
Frank frowned his displeasure with my proposal.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To have a frown on one's face.
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , figurative ) To manifest displeasure or disapprobation ; to look with disfavour or threateningly .
( transitive ) To repress or repel by expressing displeasure or disapproval ; to rebuke with a look.
